name: Elayne
headline: AI family estate planning & settlements after death
description:
Elayne empowers families to build generational wealth by automating estate planning and settlements on a single, unified platform. As the AI Executor, we manage the entire estate transfer process, facilitating $3 trillion in wealth transfers annually, with a ~3% take rate.

Adria experienced this challenge firsthand after her mom passed away, leaving her to settle the estate while balancing her career. The process is currently entirely manual and takes an average of 400 hours over 18 months. Adria eventually burned out and resigned, which is when she realized that bereavement costs businesses $100 billion annually in lost productivity, absenteeism, and attrition.

By addressing this problem through businesses, Elayne generates recurring revenue in an industry traditionally reliant on 1x transactions, while maintaining a lasting presence in the end user’s life. We directly alleviate the 43% increase in attrition following the death of a family member, while reducing overall costs for grieving families, democratizing estate support, and saving users hundreds of hours in financial, legal, and administrative tasks per loss.

founders.name: Adria Ferrier, Founder/CEO
founders.description: Co-founder / CEO at Elayne. Former large-cap private equity investor. Wharton grad.

founders.name: Jacob Grafenstein, Founder/CTO
founders.description: Chief Technology Officer at Elayne AI. Previously lead engineer on the Rocket Money (Truebill - YC16) web & mobile platform. Built a YouTube channel to 32,000 subscribers. Frequently indie hacking.

# Manage, secure, and settle estates with peace of mind
Whether protecting your family's future or navigating a loss, Elayne will meet you where you are with personalized guidance and automated solutions.
[Sign Up](https://www.elayne.com/</signup>)[Book a Demo](https://www.elayne.com/</request-demo>)

## Use Cases
Support for every chapter of life
Navigating the loss of a loved one
We simplify the financial, legal, and administrative complexities of settling an estate, so you can focus on healing.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/658f287b217b82dd1d82ba54/678dc38e4efb03fe90a71a55_Hero%201%20Bottom.avif)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/658f287b217b82dd1d82ba54/678dc38ed9c14175a19768a7_Hero%201%20Top.avif)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/658f287b217b82dd1d82ba54/678dc38e684d4ed85305dbd1_Hero%201%20Middle.avif)
Creating and preserving your legacy
Optimize your estate to protect your net worth, ensure your wishes are honored, and your family’s future is secure.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/658f287b217b82dd1d82ba54/678dbf7d806cbf1019c66cd1_Home%202%20Bottom.avif)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/658f287b217b82dd1d82ba54/678dbf7d372aafca63a11516_Home%202%20Top.avif)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/658f287b217b82dd1d82ba54/678dbf7d372aafca63a114e3_Home%202%20Middle.avif)
Organizing a loved one’s legacy
Simplify the process of managing a loved one’s legacy with expert support, from finding documents to navigating tough conversations.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/658f287b217b82dd1d82ba54/678dc85d09ddf221527835aa_Hero%203%20Bottom.avif)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/658f287b217b82dd1d82ba54/678dc85d83c75387a54a661d_Hero%203%20Top.avif)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/658f287b217b82dd1d82ba54/678dc85dc5f0946dd8eab082_Hero%203%20Middle.avif)
## How it works
Navigate loss, plan ahead, & safeguard your family’s future
[Explore the Platform](https://www.elayne.com/</platform>)
Family Network
### Family members join for free, keeping everyone aligned
Invite your family to build their own estate plans and stay connected with shared documents and a network of trusted contacts.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/658f287b217b82dd1d82ba54/67905f625feffaa8b9dbb961_1.avif)
AI-Enabled Guidance
### Smart estate plans with tailored recommendations through life’s changes
Upload documents or connect accounts to get an estate readiness assessment, detailed net worth insights, and personalized recommendations to maximize your legacy.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/658f287b217b82dd1d82ba54/67905f621ad2ad9407c9f308_2.avif)
Loss Navigation
### A bespoke roadmap and dedicated (human) concierge after loss
Clarity, compassion, and expert guidance to handle the complexities after loss, so you can focus on healing & preserving your loved one’s legacy.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/658f287b217b82dd1d82ba54/67905f62df1d8259c58b80f9_3.avif)
Financial management
### Discover, protect, and access financial accounts after loss
Secure your family’s financial future by uncovering accounts, filing claims, and automating distributions.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/658f287b217b82dd1d82ba54/67905f627179b924c8997916_4.avif)
## For Individuals & Families
Family legacy, secured with care
Protecting what matters most has never been easier—we handle everything from paperwork to estate finances.
[Solutions for Families](https://www.elayne.com/</solutions/families>)

generated_description:
**Elayne: Revolutionizing Estate Planning with AI**

Founded in 2024 and part of Y Combinator's Batch S24, Elayne is on a mission to change how families manage estate planning and settlements after death. With its innovative platform, Elayne aims to empower families to build generational wealth and simplifies the estate transfer process, which currently bogs down millions of people for an average of 400 hours over 18 months. Think about that – 400 hours of stress, paperwork, and emotional strain. 

The story behind Elayne came from a personal experience. Adria, the founder, faced the burden of settling her mother's estate while juggling her career. The weight of those responsibilities led her to a breaking point, illuminating a broader problem that costs businesses around $100 billion annually due to lost productivity when employees experience bereavement. 

**The Opportunity**

Elayne is positioned in a market dealing with over $3 trillion in annual wealth transfers, where the traditional model relies on one-time transactions. Instead, Elayne introduces a recurring revenue model that turns estate planning into an ongoing service rather than a tedious task done once and forgotten. The company aims to reduce the average attrition rate, which spikes by 43% following a family member's death. It provides substantial cost savings for grieving families by automating financial, legal, and administrative tasks, thereby giving them back hundreds of hours of precious time.

**Who It Serves**

Elayne services both employers and individuals or families. For families, the platform offers valuable solutions from creating estate plans to providing support during the aftermath of loss. Employers can utilize Elayne to enhance employee benefits, providing crucial support during difficult times, which in turn aids in retaining talent and improving workplace morale.

**How It Works**

Elayne leverages AI-driven tools to provide personalized, smart estate planning. Family members can join the platform for free, ensuring that everyone stays aligned. Users can upload documents and receive assessments regarding their estate's readiness, while a dedicated human concierge guides them through post-loss complexities. This comprehensive approach is designed to minimize the burden during life’s most challenging moments.

**Security and Privacy Matters**

In an era where personal data is prized, Elayne is committed to security and privacy, adhering to strict standards like SOC II and HIPAA while ensuring secure data encryption and multi-factor authentication.

**Why It Matters**

Addressing such a sensitive area of life with empathy and efficiency could make all the difference for families encountering hardship. Elayne doesn't just offer a service; it's a solution to a societal problem. Navigating loss is never easy, but with Elayne, it doesn’t have to be an insurmountable challenge.

For more information, visit [Elayne's website](https://www.elayne.com/). As they say, managing finances shouldn't be a burden—it's time to put peace of mind back in estate planning.
